Title: Union, IL
Descriptive Text: McHenry County, 53 miles NW of the Loop. Platted in 1851 as a station on the Galena & Chicago Union Railroad, the village failed to prosper. Incorporated in 1897, Union remained a smalltrading center. It is home to the McHenry County Historical Society and the Illinois Railway Museum. The population in 2000 was 576.
Bibliography: McHenry County in the Twentieth Century, 1968–1994. McHenry County Historical Society.1994.Nye, Lowell A., ed. McHenry County, Illinois, 1832–1968. 1968.
